Differences between private key vs keystore

To access your account on the Aion Network, you can prove ownership of the account using either the private key or the keystore file. The keystore file is for additional functionality such as protecting the private key with a password however all transactions are eventually signed with the private key of that address.



Keystore File (UTC / JSON)

  • This is encrypted file that lets you access your account. To unlock your wallet using the keystore file the password used to create the account is required. We recommend using the keystore file to access your account and backing up copies of this file in different locations.



Private Key (unencrypted)

  • This is the unencrypted text version of your private key, meaning no password is necessary. Anyone who has access to this unencrypted private key can access the corresponding wallet without a password.
  • We reccommend keeping multiple physical copies of the private key in differnet locations and storing it in a USB drive. This ensures that you do not lose your private key and access to your Aion funds, private key if lost is not recoverable
